result.execSummary:
The defendant Edith M. May was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Attempt Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $1,160.00 plus surcharges (as stipulated).
May not have contact with Soon or Robert Noel, Jennifer Garcia, or San Luis Grocery, unless otherwise permitted by the court.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  No contact with individuals who use and/or traffic in controlled substances.  Take all applicable medications as prescribed.

supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT to Ct.1 but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
CONCURRENT to Cts.1&4 but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Denying Postconviction Motion

Attorney Tom Binger appeared for the State.  Attorney Koesser appeared on behalf of the DE, who appeared in custody by phone from Taycheedah Correctional.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Attorney Koesser calls Attorney Perz as a witness, who is sworn in and testimony given; cross examination.  The State has no witnesses.  No further evidence from either party.  Arguments heard.  The court denies the motion for post-conviction relief.  Attorney Binger to file police reports by tomorrow (5/4/17).  Attorney Koesser to prepare order.
Supplementary Brief Concerning Trial Court's Duty to Ascertain Defendant's Understanding of Constitutional Rights Being Waived as a Consequence of Defendant's Guilty Plea filed by Atty Koesser

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and victim from Soon's Sushi present in court. Statement given by victim.  Sentencing arguments made.  Counts 1, 4 and 5 - Defendant is sentenced to 11 years in the WSP forthwith and each count is concurrent, but consecutive to any other sentence; 5 years Initial Confinement followed by 6 years of Extended Supervision.  Parties stipulate to restitution in the amount of $1,160.00.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  No contact with Soon or R. Noel, J. Garcia or San Luis Grocery.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
